result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery D Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes:
Hearing 10-05-2016 at 8:30am
**10/05/16-Judge John Siefert**
Restitution hearing held, Court set restitution at $0.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete Anger Management.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery D Bishop

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing held, Court set restitution at $0.

Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by the end
          of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

 Victim Impact Statement, received and filed

  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pre-trial conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel unavailable for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Freddie C.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Jeffery D Bishop in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
